revised_title: Effect of Adsorbed Gas on Soft X-Ray Emission and Photoelectric Detector
tldr: The authors investigated the effect of adsorbed gas molecules on the emission of soft X-rays and the performance of photoelectric detectors. They found that the presence of adsorbed gas significantly affects the efficiency of soft X-ray excitation and the photoelectric current. The researchers also discovered that proper degassing and surface treatment of the photoelectric detector are crucial for accurate measurements of soft X-ray emissivities and photoelectric activity of different elements.
